1500.title: At the Fortress Barbican
1500.description:
The Covenant fortress' entrance is wedged between the mountain
stone on the east and west sides with the only passable ways
being north to the fortress ward or south to the Blight.  The
entire fortress was constructed partially within the mountains
for greater defense, and a heavy spiked adamantite portcullis
looms overhead, ready to drop down as a second layer of defense
behind the massive adamantite studded ironwood doors.  A third layer
of defense in the form of another set of studded ironwood doors behind
the portcullis.  In addition to these defenses, a wooden palisade stands
at an angle facing outwards, ready to bring charges to a bloody halt.

1501.title: The Fortress Ward
1501.description:
The fortress ward is actually within the mountain itself, hollowed
out by unknown means.  It is a massive chamber designed as a
rally point for defending or in preparation for attacking.  To
the north is an entrance to go deeper into the mountain fortress.
To the east is the Covenant bestiary.

1502.title: A Dark Hallway
1502.description:
The hallway is fairly bland and the only things to see are the
everburning torches lining the walls.  It is very quiet in here,
the only sounds that can be heard are the echoes from your own
movements.  A ladder made of what appears to be darkened mithril
leads upwards and downwards.  Two doorways, one to the east and
one to the west lead off into other parts of the fortress.

1503.title: A Dark Hallway
1503.description:
The hallway is fairly bland and the only things to see are the
everburning torches lining the walls.  It is very quiet in here,
the only sounds that can be heard are the echoes from your own
movements.  A doorway to the west leads to a room filled with
cheap looking bunks while a doorway to the east leads to room
filled with more expensive looking bunks.

1504.title: A Dark Hallway
1504.description:
The hallway is fairly bland and the only things to see are the
everburning torches lining the walls.  It is very quiet in here,
the only sounds that can be heard are the echoes from your own
movements.  To the west is a doorway leading to a room filled with
bookshelves and to the east leads to a room with dozens of
ceremonial weapons and shields hanging on the walls.

1505.title: A Dark Hallway
1505.description:
The hallway is fairly bland and the only things to see are the
everburning torches lining the walls.  It is very quiet in here,
the only sounds that can be heard are the echoes from your own
movements.

1506.title: A Dark Hallway
1506.description:
The hallway is fairly bland and the only things to see are the
everburning torches lining the walls.  It is very quiet in here,
the only sounds that can be heard are the echoes from your own
movements.  To the west, a doorway leads to a room with an altar
and a statue of a female knight and a sculpture of a beautiful
winged being.

1507.title: The Shrine of the Dark Covenant
1507.description:
The room is unlit with any major light source and is a little
dark.  A half dozen candles scattered around the room provide
a little bit of light, and the statue of the Dark Maiden glows
with a soft white light as it seems to smile at you and watch
you.  The walls have been carved to depict every single soldier
sworn to the Covenant, a new face appearing by itself whenever
someone is promoted to the Knighthood.  The eyes of the carvings
are made of what appears to be precious gems and they glow without
any light source behind them.  Three cushioned kneeling benches
are arranged before the altar of this holy ground.  A doorway
leads south to a room filled with cots.

1508.title: A Dark Hallway
1508.description:
The hallway is fairly bland and the only things to see are the
everburning torches lining the walls.  It is very quiet in here,
the only sounds that can be heard are the echoes from your own
movements.  A darkened mithril ladder leading upwards is here,
allowing access to the upper floors.  A room that is nearly pitch
black lies to the east, and a room filled with an assortment of
tools lies to the west.

1509.title: A Dark Hallway
1509.description:
The hallway is fairly bland and the only things to see are the
everburning torches lining the walls.  It is very quiet in here,
the only sounds that can be heard are the echoes from your own
movements.  To the east lies a very strange room that appears
to be a miniature forest while the west has a doorway leading
to what appears to be a very large conference room.

1510.title: A Dark Hallway
1510.description:
The hallway is fairly bland and the only things to see are the
everburning torches lining the walls.  It is very quiet in here,
the only sounds that can be heard are the echoes from your own
movements.  To the east, a doorway leads to a very large room
with a bed and a lot of other things.  To the west is a similar
room with a couple of large beds and other items within.

1511.title: A Dark Hallway
1511.description:
The hallway is fairly bland and the only things to see are the
everburning torches lining the walls.  It is very quiet in here,
the only sounds that can be heard are the echoes from your own
movements.  To the south is what looks like a training room.

1512.title: A Dark Hallway
1512.description:
The hallway is fairly bland and the only things to see are the
everburning torches lining the walls.  It is very quiet in here,
the only sounds that can be heard are the echoes from your own
movements.  To the south is what looks to be some sort of
stockroom.  To the west is a bar.

1513.title: Training Room
1513.description:
This room is filled with a large number of training utilities.
Wooden dummies that spin and wobble, stationary wooden dummies,
straw dummies, bales of hay with targets attached to them, and
pendulum style archery targets adorn the walls and floor of the
room.  A strange divine aura nullifies all magic cast in here.

1514.title: General Stockroom
1514.description:
The stockroom is filled with dozens upon dozens of shelves, each
one filled with assorted things that are needed by an army.
Tents, canteens, dry rations and other things are available.
The quartermaster sits behind a counter in the middle of the
room and you notice a sign on the counter.  To the west is
a room filled with massive iron cabinets.

extras.description: It reads: I have tents, rations, canteens, sacks, and keys.  Just ask.

1515.title: Squire Barracks
1515.description:
Covenant Squires, being the lowest on the ranking ladder, stay
in this barracks when they're not training or being yelled at
by superiors.  The barracks is conveniently located across the
hall from the enlisted knights barracks so the more experienced
knights can keep an eye on the ill trained squires.

1516.title: Knight Barracks
1516.description:
Covenant squires are an undisciplined lot, prone to arguing with
each other or otherwise bothering each other if left alone too
long.  Their master knights always need to keep an eye on them,
but still give them a bit of privacy, so this barracks was built.
Located right across the hall from the Squire Barracks, the Knights
can rest here yet be close enough to storm the squire barracks
and whap unruly squires if the need arises.  The bunks and furniture
in here look to be more expensive than that of the Squire Barracks.
A painting poster has been stuck to the wall.

extras.description:
Ye gods.  Tis a poster of Supreme Commander Drinlinda that someone drew
with high quality paints.  It depicts Drinlinda in a slinky, low cut
black evening gown with thigh high slits cut up both sides of the dress.
The artist drew her facing at a slight angle to the left with her head
tossed backwards, eyes closed, and both hands in her hair.  She seems
to be wearing a pair of slippers with long heels.  The poster doesn't
leave a lot to the imagination.  The poster seems a bit worn, as if
it was hastily pulled down and hidden many times before inspection, and
then put up again later.

1517.title: Covenant Library
1517.description:
The Covenant realizes that history at times does repeat itself
and lessons of the past can be lessons for the future.  In light
of this, the Covenant made a library to store a lot of old military
history books in addition to their own books.  A very beautiful
young human member of the Chaplain Corps serves as a librarian
here, swiftly finding requested books.  A sign is mounted on
the wall.

extras.description:
Covenant Book -> Book of the Dark Covenant
Infantry Manual -> Infantry Training Manual
Leadership -> Book of Leadership
Army Book -> Book of the Army
Officer Manual -> Officer Training Manual
Ghost Manual -> Covert Operations Training Manual
Pathfinder Manual -> Pathfinder Training Manual
Chaplain Manual -> Chaplain Training Manual

1518.title: Infantry Recreation Room
1518.description:
Infantry are big, strong, and not always smart.  Their way of
solving any problem is to smash it.  As a result, members of
the other factions aren't exactly thrilled at having to share
recreation rooms with them, so this room was built.  Located
across from the library, the room has a mild sound dampener
enchantment cast upon it so as to not disturb those in the
library.  The room is quite tidy, but scratches on the walls
and small piles of smashed furniture betray the quite brutish
nature of the infantry.

1519.title: Chaplain Corps Recreation Room
1519.description:
The Chaplain Corps, being the most reclusive Covenant branch
aside from the Covert Operations Ghosts, enjoys being close to
the heavens.  This recreation room was built next to the shrine
so they could feel close to the heavens without hogging all the
space in the shrine.  Soft cushions, prayerbooks of several faiths,
and manuscripts of healing and warfare lie in neat little piles
in several locations around the room and the smell of burning
incense gives the room a relaxing atmosphere.

1520.title: Covert Operations Recreation Room
1520.description:
The Covert Operations branch of the Covenant, commonly known
as Ghosts, like training themselves constantly, practicing their
skills of subterfuge and striking from the shadows.  The room
is littered with a variety of locks of different makes, bells
hung on ropes and other odd things that only Ghosts know about.

1521.title: Workshop
1521.description:
Covenant soldiers must know how to use and maintain weapons and
armor as part of their training, but sometimes, weapons and armor
simply break from extended use.  Rather than completely depend
on an outside source completely for standard armaments, the
Covenant has built this workshop to produce any type of armor or
weaponry, provided the smiths have the materials they need.
This lets the Covenant soldiers not have to worry about running
into battle totally helpless due to a lack of equipment.

1522.title: Ranger Corps Recreation Room
1522.description:
Somehow, Lady Drinlinda managed to create a self contained forest
in a room underneath a mountain.  This miniature forest has a
small stream, medium sized trees, and even the very realistic
illusion of a sky complete with sun and weather patterns that
mimics the weather outside.  The Ranger Corps has made this its
recreation room, practicing their woodland skills and growing
various herbs here for eating, healing, and selling to others.

1523.title: Conference Room
1523.description:
Meeting delegates within cramped and sometimes smelly barracks
isn't very polite, and having meetings crouched in the hallways
or in the mess hall feels unprofessional, and so the Covenant
built this very lavish room with extremely soft, self cleaning
and repairing carpets, a beautiful table, fancy well cushioned
chairs, and a marvelous chandelier as well as a cart loaded with
food and drink.  The room is used often as a delegate meeting
room, or as a meeting room for Covenant officers.  A sign is
mounted to a painted marble wall.

extras.description:
Do not fight, sleep in, or otherwise mess up this room with litter.  It
is for meetings only, whether it be an officer meeting, delegate meeting,
or any general army meeting.

1524.title: General's Quarters
1524.description:
The General, being the highest ranked mortal of the Covenant,
has this very large private room all to themselves.  A large,
well stuffed bed made of cherrywood, a closet for holding uniforms,
a weapons and armor rack, and a personal latrine fill the room.
The room is well lit with a glowcrystal lamp hanging from the
ceiling.

1525.title: Officers' Quarters
1525.description:
The highest ranking Covenant officers gain the use of this room,
which is second only to the General's quarters in terms of comfort
and lavishness.  Several soft bunks, unlike the hard as rock
bunks in the Knight Barracks, line the walls along with personal
footlockers.  A glowcrystal lamp hangs from the ceiling and a
double latrine is embedded into the wall beside the closets and
weapons and armor racks.  There appears to be a painting on the
wall.

extras.description:
Some officer obviously liked this painting of General Taraxipus.  The artist
painted the General wearing nothing but a thin sash over her well endowed
chest and the General's arms are crossed beneath.  The General's head is
tilted down slightly towards the viewer and her eyes look up from beneath
her bangs.  Mysterious and lovely.

1526.title: A Dark Hallway
1526.description:
The hallway is fairly bland and the only things to see are the
everburning torches lining the walls.  It is very quiet in here,
the only sounds that can be heard are the echoes from your own
movements.  To the east is a doorway leading to what appears to
be a dungeon, and to the west is a room that is filled with
interrogation instruments.

1527.title: Dungeon
1527.description:
Like most dungeons, this dungeon is not well lit, has bars and
locks, and smells a bit funny.  Unlike most dungeons though,
this dungeon actually tries to let the prisoners feel comfortable,
though not too comfortable.  A long, lightly padded bench mounted
to the wall and hanging from chains and a couple of immobile,
enchanted buckets for latrines adorn the cell.

1528.title: Interrogation Room
1528.description:
Occasionally, prisoners have information that the Covenant may
want, but the prisoners refuse to give.  To solve this problem,
this interrogation room was built.  The long tables have a variety
of non lethal interrogation implements usable only by Covenant
soldiers.  Finger clamps, hot irons, a rod of shocking, and other
items are scattered on the tables along with some potions of
healing and regeneration and bottles of medicinal herbs.  A stretching
rack and a chair with clamps sit near the back of the room, both
polished and wiped clean of sweat and other bodily fluids that prisoners
sometimes deposit on them.

1529.title: Portal Room
1529.description:
This room is used mainly by the Covert Operations as a way of
inserting soldiers into strategic places throughout Thera.  The
entire room is marked with holy symbols and runes, each glowing
with power.  The way north leads to the hallway and an inscription
is carved on the floor around a portal.

1530.title: Execution Chamber
1530.description:
This room is not mentioned much by the Covenant soldiers.  It's
a room of final judgement, where Covenant soldiers who absolutely
have failed their duties face a firing squad of elite female
drow soldiers armed with crossbows with negative material tipped
bolts.  For the Covenant soldier that has repeatedly failed their
duty, this is the last place they see before going to the great
beyond.  A number of caskets are stacked in a corner and one
wall has chains attached to it, with a blindfold lying on the
floor.

1531.title: Chamber of Judgement
1531.description:
Occsionally, issues arise that require a Covenant tribunal to
determine the punishment of a soldier.  The highest three mortal
members of the Covenant come here to pass judgement upon soldiers
that have gotten themselves in trouble.

1532.title: Western Siege Weapon Tower
1532.description:
Nestled above the stockroom inside the mountain, this "tower"
isn't a tower at all since the entire fortress is built into
the mountain.  A series of powerful ballistae mounted on rotating
platforms are arranged on sliding rails, each one ready to fire
at foes outside.  The side of the mountain they are pointing
at has been completely carved out, making this room a bit drafty
but allowing for the ballistae and also archers to fire outside.
Large canvas bags filled with sand and small rocks lie in orderly
piles beside racks of bows and crossbows, barrels of filled quivers
and bolt boxes, ballista bolts, and ballista accessories.

1533.title: Eastern Siege Weapon Tower
1533.description:
Nestled above the training room inside the mountain, this "tower"
isn't a tower at all since the entire fortress is built into
the mountain.  A series of powerful ballistae mounted on rotating
platforms are arranged on sliding rails, each one ready to fire
at foes outside.  The side of the mountain they are pointing
at has been completely carved out, making this room a bit drafty
but allowing for the ballistae and also archers to fire outside.
Large canvas bags filled with sand and small rocks lie in orderly
piles beside racks of bows and crossbows, barrels of filled quivers
and bolt boxes, ballista bolts, and ballista accessories.

1534.title: Infirmary
1534.description:
Located just south of the shrine and the Chaplain Corps' recreation
room, the infirmary is where the injured are taken.  Sometimes,
if a foe has proved themselves honorable, they are taken here
to be healed also.

1535.title: Underground Farm
1535.description:
This underground farm supplements the Covenant food supply.
The illusion of a sky and the real weather that affects the Ranger
Corps' recreation room also affects this small farm where rangers
grow crops and tend to poultry coops and a small herd of cows
and sheep and a sty of pigs.  A small sheepdog can be seen running
around herding the sheep and cows away from the Ranger Corps'
recreation room.

1536.title: Covenant Bestiary
1536.description:
The battledragons and nightmares of the Covenant army dwell here,
living without cages or stables of any sort.  Piles of food
for either type of creature are piled in the corners and a large
spring welling up from underground into a water trough provides
them with water.  The creatures themselves do whatever they want
to do, and when nature calls, they have a large trough filled with
dirt which channels downwards to the underground farm to use the
waste as fertilizer.

1537.title: Armory
1537.description:
A majority of the heavy weaponry and armor of the Covenant is kept
here in locked weapons lockers.  The entire room is well lit and
each locker is polished to a gleaming shine.  The armor and weapons
not located in the lockers are arranged neatly on weapon and armor
stands.

1538.title: The Thirsty Soldier Bar
1538.description:
Serving light brews brewed by the rangers in the underground farm, the
Covenant bar provides refreshments for thirsty soldiers who have been
relieved of duty.  The bar is well decorated with various paintings of
the lovely lasses of the Covenant in full battle dress and paintings of
famous battles won by the Covenant.  A sign is mounted on the wall.

extras.description: Just say "Beer please" and I'll give you a beer.  It's all paid for.

1539.title: Intelligence Office
1539.description:
Maps, hastily scribbled notes, diagrams, and sketches of various people
and monsters are scattered all over the walls and even the ceiling of this
room.  Covert Operatives run around comparing notes and sending runners to
the officers, making this place quite noisy.  The room is lit with a couple
of glowcrystal lamps, making it fairly well lit.
